text:
Equipment

  • Copies of the Product Game board
  • two paper clips
  • two different- color markers or two chips (Each player uses a different color).

Rules

Play as individuals or in teams.

  • Player A puts a paper clip on a number in the factor list. Since it takes at least two factors to make a product, Player A does not mark anything on the board.
  • Player B puts the other paper clip on any number in the factor list. Player B may select the same number as Player A. Player B shades or covers the product of the two factors on the product board.
  • Player A moves either one of the paper clips to another number. Player A shades or covers the new product with a different color than Player B.
  • Players take turns moving a paper clip and marking the product. A product can only be marked by one player. If a product is already marked, the player does not get a mark for that turn.
  • The winner is the first player to ark four squares in a row (up and down, across, or diagonally).

• Play the game a few times. Describe some strategies you used.
  • How are the Factor Game and the Product Game similar? How are they different?
